tweet: #SCOTUS will consider the #DACA case next term. DACA recipients are part of the fabric of our nation, and I will not stop fighting until we have secured full protection for all #DREAMers. DACA remains in effect and current recipients can still renew their status now.

I am appalled by this administration's consistent efforts to separate immigrant families. If you or someone you know could be impacted by the proposed ICE raids it is imperative that you #KnowYourRights. We must continue to fight efforts to target our immigrant communities.

The proposed #PublicCharge rule is another senseless attempt by the Trump Admin to advance its anti-immigrant agenda at the expense of our communities. I am proud to join @RepJudyChu and @CAPAC colleagues as a cosponsor of the No Federal Funds for Public Charge Act.

Far too many people have lost their lives as a result of gun violence.  I will continue to support common sense legislation that will help reduce and prevent gun violence. #GunViolenceAwarenessDay #WearOrange pic.twitter.com/roI6WWquE3

75 years ago today, more than 150,000 American, British and Canadian troops stormed Normandy’s beaches, in what would be the turning point of World War II. We owe a great debt to our veterans for their courage and sacrifice. #DDay75thAnniversary

I am proud to have voted for H.R. 6, the #DreamAndPromiseAct, on the House floor today. The House sent a clear message today that we stand in support of the immigrant community and will continue to push back against this Administration’s dangerous actions.
